item.title: Vim Refactoring Patterns
item.description: Editor macros are a secret weapon for editing text. While they are hard to learn, no other tool offers such broad speed and power for automating changes. A skilled macro wielder can make huge changes to a codebase with ease. Here are some inspirational patterns to demonstrate major structural refactorings using Vim macros and search/replace commands. Reorder A List Of Numbers A change left me with a file with unordered numbers.

item.title: Editor Abstractions
item.description: (Want to become a Vim expert? Check out my new book: 10 Minute Vim) I was recently inspired by a comment from a respected coworker: “I am just as productive with basic Vim commands as I am with a refactoring suite like ReSharper.” I have pair-programmed with him for hundreds of hours of C# development. He is equally productive with both, that much I know. On some tasks he is less efficient than with ReSharper, on others he is more.
